poem:
### Fate of the Bamboo

In lands far from bamboo's shade,  
the panda wanders, uprooted,  
drawn by the artifice of screens.  
Beside him, a dragon,  
hollow fire in its belly  
breathes stories spun like silk.  
Beneath African skies,  
the wild whispers echoes  
of tales told better,  
leaving shadows hungry  
for the depth of untamed truth.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Panda Bear in Africa review – bear meets dragon in cross between Lion King and Kung Fu Panda Here is an animated feature, financed by production companies spanning the European Union, about a panda and his dragon best friend having adventures in Africa; it is, to be honest, sensationally derivative and not on the same level as Pixar, Disney or even Dreamworks films at their best. Even those studios are very derivative these days, quite". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
